[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: new()] [Panic attack] Can a malicious validator or configuration error trigger the assert!(capacity > 0) panic by passing zero capacity, causing validator node crashes and consensus liveness failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_back()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to push_back() from different threads cause race conditions where is_full() check and pop_front() are non-atomic, leading to incorrect eviction behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_back()] [Assertion failure] Can the assert!(self.inner.len() <= self.capacity) fail due to concurrent modifications, causing validator panics and consensus liveness loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_back()] [State corruption] If push_back() is called during iteration, can the returned oldest value be stale or incorrect due to race conditions, causing consensus logic errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_back()] [Memory leak] When evicting items via pop_front(), are associated resources (DropGuards, allocations) properly cleaned up, or can repeated evictions cause memory leaks in long-running validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_front()] [Data loss] When CommitEvents are added via push_front() in leader reputation, can eviction from pop_back() discard critical validator performance data needed for accurate reputation calculation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_front()] [Race condition] Can concurrent push_front() and push_back() operations interleave incorrectly due to non-atomic is_full() check, causing capacity violations or data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-collections/src/bounded_vec_deque.rs] [Function: push_front()] [Assertion failure] Can the assert!(self.inner.len() <= self.capacity) in push_front() be violated through edge cases with capacity=1, causing validator crashes? (Medium)
